If you have an interest in continuing to use R with Qualtrics, consider taking a look at the following resources

```{r echo=FALSE}

paper <- tibble(
  
  title = c(
    "<i>Importing Surveys Into Qualtrics And Moving Data From Qualtrics To R</i>",
    "<i>R Coding in Stats iQ</i>"
    ),
  
  Source = c(
    "PSYC 4780: Advanced Research Methods & Statistics Using R by Dr. David J. Stanley @ the University of Guelph (2022)",
    "Qualtrics"
    ),
  
  Arrow = c(
    "external",
    "external"
    ),
  
  Icon = c(
    "webpage",
    "webpage"
    ),
  
  Site = c(
    "https://dstanley4.github.io/psyc4780bookdown/qualtrics.html#qualtrics-data-to-r",
    "https://www.qualtrics.com/support/stats-iq/analyses/r-coding-in-stats-iq/"
    ),
  
  .name_repair = "minimal"
  
)

```

<center>
```{r, echo=FALSE}
paper %>%
  mutate(Icon = case_when(
    str_detect(`Icon`, "slack") ~ '<img src="/logos/slack-ico.png" alt="Slack icon" width="25px">',
    str_detect(`Icon`, "ecampus") ~ '<img src="/logos/wvu-gold-ico.png" alt="Slack icon" width="25px">',
    str_detect(`Icon`, "library") ~ '<img src="/logos/library-ico.png" alt="Slack icon" width="25px">',
    str_detect(`Icon`, "webpage") ~ '<img src="/logos/webpage-ico.png" alt="Slack icon" width="25px">',
    TRUE ~ NA_character_
    )
  ) %>%
  mutate(Arrow = case_when(
    str_detect(`Arrow`, "external") ~ '<div style="font-size: 0.5rem;"><i class="fa fa-external-link fa-2x" aria-hidden="true" style="color:#559977"></i></div>',
    TRUE ~ NA_character_
    )
  ) %>%
  mutate(Site = na_if(Site, "")) %>%
  mutate(Link = case_when(
    !is.na(Icon) ~ paste0("<a href=",Site," target='_blank'>",Icon,"</a>"),
    TRUE ~ "Please check this week's download"
    )
  ) %>%
  select(-Icon, -Site, -Arrow) %>% 
  mutate_all(replace_na,"") %>%
  kbl(col.names = c("Title", "Citation", "Link"), 
      "html", 
      escape = FALSE,
      align = 'llc') %>%
  kable_paper(full_width = FALSE) %>%
  column_spec(1, width = "40em") %>%
  column_spec(2, width = "20em") %>%
  column_spec(3, width = "10em") %>% 
  row_spec(0:nrow(paper), extra_css = 'vertical-align: middle !important;', color = "#f7f7f7", background = "transparent")
```
</center>
